intro: Oryctanthus guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan earthcress, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Oryctanthus guatemalensis is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, showcasing its resilience in diverse environments.
